meanings.definition: To fly or rise high in the air.
meanings.sent1: The eagle soared gracefully above the trees.
meanings.sent2: The plane soared through the clouds.
meanings.sent3: The kite soared higher than the rooftops, making the children cheer.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits soared like a bird set free from its cage.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon soared gently in the sky, offering a breathtaking view.

meanings.definition: To increase rapidly in value or level.
meanings.sent1: Stock prices soared after the positive earnings report.
meanings.sent2: The demand for the new product soared within days of its release.
meanings.sent3: Her excitement soared when she won the lottery unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The temperature soared to record highs during the heatwave.
meanings.sent5: The popularity of the band soared after their hit song went viral.

meanings.definition: To rise or increase to a great height.
meanings.sent1: The skyscraper soared above the city skyline.
meanings.sent2: The mountain goat effortlessly soared up the steep cliff.
meanings.sent3: The rocket soared into space, leaving a trail of smoke behind.
meanings.sent4: His confidence soared as he aced the difficult exam.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks soared into the night sky, painting it with vibrant colors.
